member.name: P:DurableTask.Core.Common.Utils.AppName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the app, for use when writing structured event source traces.
member.remarks: The default value comes from the WEBSITE_SITE_NAME environment variable, which is defined in Azure App Service. Other environments can use DTFX_APP_NAME to set this value.

member.name: P:DurableTask.Core.Common.Utils.RedactUserCodeExceptions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to redact user code exceptions from log output.
member.remarks: This value defaults to true if the WEBSITE_SITE_NAME is set to a non-empty value, which is always the case in hosted Azure environments where log telemetry is automatically captured. This value can be also be set explicitly by assigning the DTFX_REDACT_USER_CODE_EXCEPTIONS environment variable to "1" or "true".

member.name: T:DurableTask.Core.ErrorPropagationMode
member.summary: Specifies the mechanism for propagating unhandled exception information from tasks to their parent orchestrations.

member.name: F:DurableTask.Core.ErrorPropagationMode.SerializeExceptions
member.summary: Unhandled exceptions are serialized and surfaced to callers via the property of . This is the legacy behavior and doesn't work for all exception types.

member.name: F:DurableTask.Core.ErrorPropagationMode.UseFailureDetails
member.summary: Details of unhandled exceptions are surfaced via the property. The original exception objects are not serialized and deserialized across tasks. This option is preferred when consistency is required or in advanced scenarios where orchestration or activity code are executed out of process, potentially in other language runtimes that don't support .NET/CLR exceptions.

member.name: T:DurableTask.Core.Serializing.RuntimeStateStreamConverter
member.summary: A converter that does conversion between the OrchestrationRuntimeState instance and a stream after serialization. The stream is a serialized OrchestrationSessionState that will set as session state. De-serialization is done with fallbacks in the order: OrchestrationSessionState -> OrchestrationRuntimeState -> IList of HistoryEvent.
Convert an OrchestrationRuntimeState instance to a serialized raw stream to be saved in session state.
member.param: The new OrchestrationRuntimeState to be serialized
The current runtime state
A data converter for serialization and deserialization
True if should compress when serialization
The service bus session settings
A blob store for external blob storage
The session id
member.returns: A serialized raw stream to be saved in session state

member.name: M:DurableTask.Core.Serializing.RuntimeStateStreamConverter.RawStreamToRuntimeState(System.IO.Stream,System.String,DurableTask.Core.Tracking.IOrchestrationServiceBlobStore,DurableTask.Core.Serializing.DataConverter)
member.summary: Convert a raw stream to an orchestration runtime state instance.
member.param: The raw session stream to be deserialized
The session Id
A blob store for external blob storage
>A data converter for serialization and deserialization

member.name: M:DurableTask.Core.Serializing.RuntimeStateStreamConverter.DeserializeToRuntimeStateWithFallback(System.String,DurableTask.Core.Serializing.DataConverter,System.String,System.String@)
member.summary:
Deserialize the session state to construct an OrchestrationRuntimeState instance.
The session state string could be one of these: 1. a serialized IList of HistoryEvent (master branch implementation), or 2. a serialized OrchestrationRuntimeState instance with the history event list (vnext branch implementation), or 3. a serialized OrchestrationSessionState instance with the history event list or a blob key (latest implementation).
So when doing the deserialization, it is done with fallbacks in the order: OrchestrationSessionState -> OrchestrationRuntimeState -> IList of HistoryEvent, to cover all cases.
member.param: The serialized session state
A data converter for serialization and deserialization
The session Id
The blob key output. Will be set if the state is in external storage.
member.returns: The converted orchestration runtime state.

member.summary: Gets or sets the error propagation behavior when an activity or orchestration fails with an unhandled exception.

remarks.para: Use caution when making changes to this property over the lifetime of an application. In-flight orchestrations could fail unexpectedly if there is any logic that depends on a particular behavior of exception propagation. For example, setting causes to be populated in and but also causes the property to be null for these exception types.
This property must be set before the worker is started. Otherwise it will have no effect.
